drain.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make the water or liquid in something flow away
drain.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The swimming pool is drained and cleaned every winter.
Can you drain the spaghetti, please  (=pour away the water from the pan)?
Brad drained all the oil from the engine.
drain.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if liquid drains away, it flows away
drain.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I watched the bath water drain away.
drain.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if something drains, the liquid that is in it or on it flows away and it becomes dry
drain.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: She washed up and left the dishes to drain.
This plant needs rich, well-drained soil.
drain.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to make someone feel very tired and without any energy
drain.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Working with children all day really drains you.
drain.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to use too much of something, especially money, so that there is not enough left
drain.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Huge imports were draining the country’s currency reserves.
drain.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a pipe that carries water or waste liquids away
drain.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The flood was caused by a blocked drain.
There’s a problem with the drains.
drain.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the frame of metal bars over a drain where water etc can flow into it
drain.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the hole in the bottom of a bath or sink that water flows out through
drain.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: something that continuously uses up a lot of money, time, or effort
drain.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: This project has been a serious drain on our financial resources.
drain.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to use too much of something so that there is not enough left
drain.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The high cost of road maintenance is draining funds from the local government budget.
Huge imports were draining the country’s currency reserves.
